meanings.definition: To move ahead of or beyond someone or something in a competitive or forward-moving way.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit leapfrogged the turtle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The student leapfrogged his classmates to reach the top of the class.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel leapfrogged the bird to get to the acorn first.
meanings.sent4: The new technology leapfrogged the old methods in efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete leapfrogged the competition with her speed.

meanings.definition: To jump over someone or something in a game or playful manner.
meanings.sent1: The children leapfrogged over each other in the park.
meanings.sent2: The dog leapfrogged over the hurdle with ease.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to leapfrog over the fence but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: The gymnast leapfrogged over the balance beam gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The friends decided to leapfrog over the puddles on their way home.
